intro: Holmskioldia tettensis f. alba, commonly known as the white-flowered holmskioldia, is a rare and ornamental plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and clusters of small, white flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant is native to specific regions in southern Africa, where it grows in rocky or sandy soils. Its unique appearance makes it a sought-after specimen for botanical gardens and specialized collections. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
